articles.title: The Factors That Put You At Risk For A Blood Clot In Your Arm
articles.author: Robin Rothstein
articles.excerpt: Blood clots in the arm can be dangerous. Here are the signs and symptoms to look out for, and how you can help prevent blood clots from developing.
articles.summary:
When you injure yourself in a way that prompts bleeding, it's normal for your body to naturally react and repair the injury through blood clotting, or coagulation, according to Cleveland Clinic. This reaction is called hemostasis -- the word "hemo" means "blood" and "stasis" means "standing still." Normal hemostasis is a vital capability of your body, helping to keep you alive by stopping bleeding in the case of serious injuries.
A collection of processes, hemostasis is made up of several stages that occur simultaneously.

articles.title: UN expert questions sincerity of Myanmar's prisoner release
articles.author: Associated Press
articles.excerpt: SEOUL, South Korea (AP) — The recent release of thousands of prisoners in Myanmar is likely an attempt by its military-controlled government to 'create a veneer of progress' in the country to sway…
articles.summary:
SEOUL, South Korea (AP) — The recent release of thousands of prisoners in Myanmar is likely an attempt by its military-controlled government to 'create a veneer of progress' in the country to sway international opinion, a U.N. expert said Monday.
Myanmar freed about 5,700 prisoners on the occasion of the National Victory Day last Thursday. Among them were foreign nationals — an Australian academic, a Japanese filmmaker, an ex-British diplomat and an American. Australia, the United States and rights groups welcomed the releases while calling for Myanmar to free others unjustly detained.

articles.summary: The Deputy Minister of Education of the Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan, Mawlavi Sakhaullah Saeed, met with, the Deputy Ambassador of Japan to Kabul, Takuya Tanimoto. 'Japan has good relations with Afghanistan as always and the Islamic Emirate strives to have close relations,' said Saeed. For his part, Tanimoto said that his country will cooperate with Afghanistan's education sector. According to the Ministry of Education, both sides discussed the quality and quantity of education in detail in the meeting.

articles.title: What's On Your Wall?
articles.author: Will
articles.excerpt: Restaurant, hospitality and grocery insiders call it The Wall.
articles.summary: CONTRIBUTOR ARTICLE 21 November 2022 Adams and Reese To print this article, all you need is to be registered or login on Mondaq.com. Restaurant, hospitality and grocery insiders call it The Wall. You know, the place where you have to publicly display your liquor license and other stuff the State of Tennessee issues. We hear it all too often from restaurant, bar, hotel, liquor store and grocery store owners and managers: what signs do I have to post on the wall? Here is what Tennessee state law requires you to publicly post: ABC Liquor License City or County Beer Permit Certificate of Registration City Business License County Business License Certificate of Occupancy Most recent Health Inspection Report ABC pregnancy warning sign for restaurants, bars, hotels and other on-premise establishments Liquor and grocery stores also have to post the Responsible Wine Vendor letter, which is renewed annually with the liquor license.

articles.title: Bombers' Collaros makes no excuses, credits Argonauts after Grey Cup loss
articles.author: Jeff Dedekker
articles.excerpt: REGINA — Quarterback Zach Collaros made no excuses after the Toronto Argonauts upset the two-time defending Grey Cup champion Winnipeg Blue Bombers 24-23 Sunday in the CFL title game.
articles.summary:
REGINA — Quarterback Zach Collaros made no excuses after the Toronto Argonauts upset the two-time defending Grey Cup champion Winnipeg Blue Bombers 24-23 Sunday in the CFL title game.
Collaros, the reigning two-time CFL Most Outstanding Player, sat in front of the media after the stunning setback and tried to explain why the heavily-favoured Bombers lost to the Argos.
'I don't think that we got into a good rhythm at any point in the game offensively," said Collaros, who finished 14-of-23 passing for 183 yards and one interception.

articles.title: Earthquake shakes Indonesia's Java island; at least 14 dead
articles.author: Edna Tarigan
articles.excerpt: JAKARTA, Indonesia (AP) — An earthquake shook Indonesia's main island of Java on Monday, killing at least 14 people, damaging dozens of buildings and sending residents into the capital's streets for…
articles.summary: JAKARTA, Indonesia (AP) — An earthquake shook Indonesia's main island of Java on Monday, killing at least 14 people, damaging dozens of buildings and sending residents into the capital's streets for safety. The U.S. Geological Survey said the magnitude 5.6 quake was centered in the Cianjur region in West Java province at a depth of 10 kilometers (6.2 miles). It killed at least 14 people and injured 17 others, National Disaster Mitigation Agency chief Suharyanto said. Dozens of buildings were damaged, including an Islamic boarding school, a hospital and other public facilities, the agency said.

articles.title: Volleyball: Ohio's season comes to an end against Buffalo
articles.author: Gorbett
articles.excerpt: The Bobcats fell in the first round of the MAC Tournament.
articles.summary:
Ohio (19-11, 13-6 Mid-American Conference) had a storied and successful season, but it is now over after a loss in the first round of the MAC Tournament to Buffalo (19-12, 11-8 MAC).
Because of the MAC's depth, the Bobcats knew they would take on a difficult opponent in the first round, and the Bulls proved they were up to the task in the first set. The Bobcats started fast in the first set and took a 16-9 lead. Although the Bulls got right back in the set with five straight points, the Bobcats appeared to have steadied the ship with three of four points.

articles.title: From 'Guru' to Isha Ambani's newborn babies, the twin connection of India's second richest family
articles.author: ET Online
articles.excerpt: The Reliance Retail director became a mother to fraternal twins - a boy and a girl.
articles.summary:
Billionaire Mukesh Ambani became a grandfather for the second time after philanthropist-daughter Isha welcomed her twins with businessman-husband Anand Piramal on Saturday (November 19). The twin connection in the Ambani family goes a long way - from Isha-Akash and the newborns of the RIL heiress to the 2007 movie 'Guru'. 
Just like herself and her twin Akash, the Reliance Retail director became a mother to fraternal twins - a boy and a girl. In a statement released on Sunday, the family shared that the new parents have named the babies - Aadiya and Krishna.

articles.summary: It's either Germany or Brazil who will lift the coveted World Cup trophy.This was the view of several interviewed yesterday while witnessing the opening match of the 2022 World Cup where Ecuador defeated Qatar two-nil before thousands of fans in their home country.Almost all bars with a working television appeared to be filled yesterday. Bars off Tragarete Road and Ariapita Avenue seemed to be the epicentre of Trinidad's football fan base, but yesterday's match failed to excite.At the All Out Sports Bar and Gourmet Grill on Tragarete Road, fans were not dressed in the colours of the two teams playing yesterday, but one man wearing a traditional Arabic head-gear, or a Kafiya Keffiyeh, said he was backing Qatar.

articles.title: Firefighters expected to leave Neah Bay today
articles.author: Leah Leach
articles.excerpt: NEAH BAY — Wildfires that forced the evacuation of about 100 people in Neah Bay on Thursday were just about wrapped up on Sunday with state Department of Natural Resources crews expecting to leave…
articles.summary:
NEAH BAY — Wildfires that forced the evacuation of about 100 people in Neah Bay on Thursday were just about wrapped up on Sunday with state Department of Natural Resources crews expecting to leave today.
‘They are not fully extinguished, but there has been no new growth in the fires,' Makah Tribal Chair T.J. Greene said Sunday.
'At last report everything was at 90 or 100 percent contained,' he said.
Residents were allowed to return to their homes on Friday while schools and tribal operations remained closed as crews battled several fires that broke out early Thursday morning, fanned by high winds with gusts above 50 mph.

articles.title: Port: Point Hudson jetty rebuild ahead of schedule
articles.author: Peninsula Daily News
articles.excerpt: Earlier reopening likely, officials say
articles.summary:
Earlier reopening likely, officials say
 An aerial view of the north jetty shows it as it is being rebuilt at the Point Hudson Marina. PORT TOWNSEND — The rebuild of the jetty at Point Hudson that protects the marina from storms is ahead of schedule, say officials with the Port of Port Townsend.
Capital Facilities Director Matt Klontz said last week that Orion Marine Contractors is a week or 10 days ahead of schedule and that the marina may be able to open earlier than Orion's March 1 deadline, according to a press release.

articles.summary:
TACOMA — The Peninsula College men's basketball team came from behind twice to win a pair of games this weekend, 67-55 over Tacoma and 66-64 over Green River, the No. 3-ranked team in the Northwest Athletic Conference.
Meanwhile, the women, the preseason No. 1 team in the NWAC, were missing some of their key players early in the season and lost their first two games, 61-54 to Walla Walla and 89-75 to Columbia Basin.
Back to the men's games, the Pirates immediately fell behind Tacoma 16-3 on Friday and were still down 29-22 at the half.

articles.title: Anti-abortion groups argue over next steps in wake of election losses
articles.author: Alice Miranda Ollstein
articles.excerpt: The divisions among anti-abortion groups and Republican leaders threaten to undercut a movement that for decades has shaped party platforms, tipped the scales in primaries, and helped steer the…
articles.summary:
Abortion opponents are pushing the GOP to campaign more openly and forcefully against the procedure after the party suffered a string of losses in House, Senate, state legislative and ballot initiative fights.
Less than six months after celebrating their decades-long goal of toppling Roe v. Wade and watching access to abortion nearly disappear in a quarter of the country, conservatives saw their hard-fought court victory galvanize abortion-rights supporters to outspend and outvote them in the midterms.

articles.title: Nordic Water's Zickert Technology Gives New Lease Of Life To 70-Year Old Argentine Water Treatment Facility
articles.excerpt: Constructed in 1950, the Donato Gerardi treatment plant provides drinking water to 800'000 people in the province of Buenos Aires, Argentina.
articles.summary: One of Argentina's most important water treatment plants has completed a transformation of its sedimentation tanks. It has increased its capacity, vastly improved its reliability and reduced its environmental footprint following the installation of Zickert sludge scraper technology from Nordic Water, a Sulzer brand. Constructed in 1950, the Donato Gerardi treatment plant provides drinking water to 800'000 people in the province of Buenos Aires, Argentina. As the facility approached its 70th birthday, however, its age was beginning to show.

articles.title: Utah's COVID-19 deaths number 13 in the last week

articles.summary: FILE PHOTO: New visualization of the Covid-19 virus by Fusion Medical Animation LOGAN – The weekly COVID-19 update from the Utah Division of Health and Human Services (DHHS) includes 13 deaths from the coronavirus in the last seven days with 2,787 new cases in that same period. Since the start of the pandemic 32 months ago there have been 5,089 COVID deaths and 39,554 hospitalizations statewide. As of Thursday 127 Utahns were hospitalized with COVID-19, one more than the previous week, with 18 patients in intensive care.

articles.title: Digital transformation in publishing with Samsung Knox
articles.author: Press Gazette
articles.excerpt: How Samsung Knox helps publishers transform their subscriber strategy and create dedicated news devices.
articles.summary: Sponsored: How Samsung Knox helps publishers transform their subscriber strategy and create dedicated news devices. News and entertainment media has always been the cornerstone of how society learns, shares and thinks. However, it has also been in a constant state of flux since the advent of digital technology. Publications have gone global and instant access to a democratised news media is available to anyone with a smartphone. Between competition for readers, subscriber retention, noisy requests for app downloads and increased marketing costs, businesses are struggling to keep up.

articles.title: Turkey introduces new rules for energy storage
articles.author: Emiliano Bellini
articles.excerpt: The Turkish government has published long-awaited rules for energy storage in its official journal. Local solar association Günder said the first projects will be approved in the middle of 2023.
articles.summary: The Turkish government has introduced new rules for energy storage. The new rules will allow storage facilities to operate in combination with unlicensed power plants. Such plants will be allowed to increase their wind or solar capacity up to the installed power of the storage facility.'These capacity increases will be counted within the scope of the renewable energy resources support mechanism (YEKDEM) incentive,' Eren Engur, a Günder board member, told pv magazine. 'Lost energy in production and storage facilities will not be counted under the incentive or purchase guarantee.

articles.title: IWA Marks World Toilet Day 2022 With Call For SanitAction
articles.excerpt: The International Water Association (IWA) is marking UN World Toilet Day, held annually on 19 November to raise awareness of the 3.6 billion people living without access to safely managed sanitation…
articles.summary: The International Water Association (IWA) is marking UN World Toilet Day, held annually on 19 November to raise awareness of the 3.6 billion people living without access to safely managed sanitation worldwide. The Association is a formal supporter of the awareness day promoted by UN Water. This year's theme focuses on making the invisible visible, highlighting the connection between safe sanitation and groundwater protection. Building on this theme, IWA has published a blog series exploring the issues and opportunities around sanitation.

articles.title: Chariot forms new renewable power consortium for South Africa
articles.author: Philip Whiterow
articles.excerpt: Etana has been granted an electricity trading licence, which gives it the right to buy and sell electricity on South Africa's power grid
articles.summary: Chariot Ltd (AIM:CHAR, OTC:OIGLF) has formed a new joint venture through a 25% interest in a new South African electricity trading company, Etana Energy. South Africa is the largest electricity market on the continent but has regular power outages due to insufficient supply. To combat this energy crisis, rapid market deregulation is currently taking place, said Chariot, which includes selectively issuing electricity trading licences and approving projects of up to 100MW generation capacity. Etana has been granted an electricity trading licence, which gives it the right to buy and sell electricity on the national transmission grid and within some selected municipal areas.

articles.summary: November 21, 2022 Vietnam sees increased numbers for pigs, poultry and cows in first nine months of 2022 Vietnam's livestock production has grown steadily in the first nine months of 2022. At the end of October 2022, the total number of pigs in the country was estimated to have increased by 13.6% compared to the same period last year. The total number of poultry increased by 5.2% and cows by 3.3%. Production of slaughter pigs in the first three quarters of the year was estimated at 3.23 million tonnes, 5.

articles.title: Sonic the Hedgehog co-creator arrested over insider trading
articles.author: The Star Online
articles.excerpt: TOKYO: The co-creator of classic video game series Sonic the Hedgehog has been arrested for alleged insider trading, according to public prosecutors in Tokyo.
articles.summary: TOKYO: The co-creator of classic video game series Sonic the Hedgehog has been arrested for alleged insider trading, according to public prosecutors in Tokyo. Yuji Naka, a 57-year-old programmer known for making Sonic and other major titles at Japanese game firm Sega, was arrested on Friday, a prosecution document obtained by AFP said. His alleged misdeed took place nearly three years ago, when Naka was an employee at "Final Fantasy" creator Square Enix, the Tokyo District Prosecutors Office document said.

articles.title: How And When To Make Resting Your Superpower
articles.author: Jodie Cook
articles.excerpt: When you're building a company from scratch, shutting the laptop never seems like a good idea. Plenty of startup founders simply don't stop. They keep going, staring at the screen, producing and…
articles.summary: When you're building a company from scratch, shutting the laptop never seems like a good idea. Plenty of startup founders simply don't stop. They keep going, staring at the screen, producing and hustling. Although in time this might compromise their health, wellbeing and happiness, they are often successful in getting their business off the ground. So is their approach right or wrong? When should you rest and when should you work? While the anti-hustle movement is persuasive, it's not right at every stage and the topic is more nuanced than one-size-fits-all.

articles.title: Study suggests bats are an underrecognized arenavirus reservoir
articles.excerpt: Researchers reported the detection of arenavirus RNA from various species of bats sampled between 2007 and 2011 from Brazil.
articles.summary:
In a recent study published in the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention's (CDC) journal Emerging Infectious Diseases, a team of researchers reported the detection of arenavirus ribonucleic acid (RNA) from various species of bats sampled between 2007 and 2011 from Brazil.

Background

Of the four genera present in the virus family Arenaviridae, Mammarenavirus is the only genus that infects mammals. The genus is divided into the New World arenaviruses and the choriomeningitis–Lassa virus serocomplex, distributed worldwide.

articles.title: Iger Named Disney CEO, Again, Effective Immediately
articles.author: City News Service
articles.excerpt: The Walt Disney Company brought back Bob Iger tonight to lead the company as its chief executive.
articles.summary: Photo: Getty ImagesBURBANK (CNS) - The Walt Disney Company brought back Bob Iger tonight to lead the company as its chief executive.   'I am extremely optimistic for the future of this great company and thrilled to be asked by the Board to return as its CEO,' Iger said.   'Disney and its incomparable brands and franchises hold a special place in the hearts of so many people around the globe -- most especially in the hearts of our employees, whose dedication to this company and its mission is an inspiration,' he said.

articles.title: Tonya Khoury
articles.excerpt: Seven Days on Twitter: A media dive Hello South Africa, tell me how you're doing? You
articles.summary: Seven Days on Twitter: A media dive Hello South Africa, tell me how you're doing? You've survived another week and I, for one, am enormously proud of how you're still standing. Let's check in on our mental health before reading this report. Read more

articles.title: Sanctions, drop in demand cause Russian car sales to collapse
articles.excerpt: President Vladimir Putin has urged the Russian government to control car prices
articles.summary: MOSCOW, Russia: As Western sanctions are sending annual car sales in Russia crashing to below 1 million for the first time since records began being kept, President Vladimir Putin has urged the Russian government to control car prices.Maxim Sokolov, head of Russia's top carmaker, Avtovaz, said so far this year, car sales have fallen over 60 percent and may end up being less than one-quarter of the figure from a decade ago.This year's drop is mainly due to a collapse in demand following the mobilization for the invasion of Ukraine, as well as the pullout from Russia of foreign carmakers, such as Renault and Mercedes-Benz.

articles.title: Wada Farms showcasing full lineup at New York Produce Show
articles.excerpt: Fresh off the inaugural IFPA conference and trade show held during late October in Orlando, FL, Wada Farms is among several hundred exhibitors at the 2022 New York Produce Show at the New York Hilton…
articles.summary:
Fresh off the inaugural IFPA conference and trade show held during late October in Orlando, FL, Wada Farms is among several hundred exhibitors at the 2022 New York Produce Show at the New York Hilton and Javits Center in downtown Manhattan.
The four-day show, with its Dec. 2 one-day trade show and three co-located conferences, provides unique educational and networking opportunities for the produce industry, and Wada's Director of Marketing Eric Beck said the company will shine the spotlight on all its products during the tradeshow in booth No.

articles.title: Earthquake shakes Indonesia's Java island; at least 14 dead
articles.excerpt: JAKARTA, Indonesia (AP) — An earthquake shook Indonesia's main island of Java on Monday, killing at least 14 people, damaging dozens of buildings and sending residents into the capital's streets
articles.summary: JAKARTA, Indonesia (AP) — An earthquake shook Indonesia's main island of Java on Monday, killing at least 14 people, damaging dozens of buildings and sending residents into the capital's streets for safety.The U.S. Geological Survey said the magnitude 5.6 quake was centered in the Cianjur region in West Java province at a depth of 10 kilometers (6.2 miles).It killed at least 14 people and injured 17 others, National Disaster Mitigation Agency chief Suharyanto said. Dozens of buildings were damaged, including an Islamic boarding school, a hospital and other public facilities, the agency said.

articles.title: Doctor vs. Architect?
articles.excerpt: How do the two compare in the rigor in school and the profession? Did you ever contemplate about the two? If you did, did you ever regret your choice of becoming an architect? Anyways, the title…
articles.summary: 8 years of education, endless hours working on projects in grad school, designing a new methodology for assisted care living based on Palliative care models. Worked thousands of hours to have enough hours to be allowed to test and obtain licensure, hundreds of hours to pass 7 state exams each harder than the single exam to become MD, and listening to people who went to sleep on average at 10pm during grad school who call themselves doctors telling me you save lives or that society needs you and they do not need me.

articles.title: Pound slips back against the US dollar
articles.author: Jeremy Cutler
articles.excerpt: Sterling slipped back against the US dollar as the greenback made a strong start to the week.
articles.summary: The US dollar kicked off the week on a positive foot on the back of a retreat in dovish Fed expectations.  The pound was quoted at $1.1827 early Monday in London, down a full US cent from $1.1929 late Friday, the euro traded at $1.0278, down from $1.0362, while against the yen, the dollar was quoted at Y140.70, 139.85. Sterling is seen facing resistance near the $1.1960 level while the 1.2030 area remains the broader resistance, this is likely to be a huge barrier for any further gains. Support remains all the way back at the $1.

articles.title: China reports 2 more COVID-19 deaths
articles.excerpt: World's largest populated nation sees steep uptick in coronavirus cases due to spread of highly contagious sub-variants - Anadolu Agency
articles.summary: ISTANBUL Amid the rising number of COVID-19 cases in the country, China announced two more deaths due to the virus on Monday.Two fresh deaths due to the coronavirus were reported in the capital Beijing, the Chinese daily Global Times reported.China reported the first death, of an 87-year-old man who died of sepsis triggered by a serious lung infection, in the past six months on Saturday. However, the health authorities released the information on Sunday. This was the country's first recorded fatality from the virus since May 26.

articles.title: Francis Atwoli re-elected as Trade Unionists number two
articles.author: David Njaaga
articles.excerpt: COTU Secretary-General Francis Atwoli has been re-elected for the fourth term to the position of Vice President of International Trade Union Confederation (ITUC).
articles.summary:
Central Organization of Trade Unions (COTU) Secretary-General Francis Atwoli.[Elvis Ogina,Standard]

Central Organization of Trade Unions (COTU) Secretary-General Francis Atwoli has been re-elected for the fourth term to the position of Vice President of International Trade Union Confederation (ITUC).
ITUC is the world's largest trade union federation with a membership of over 200 million drawn from 163 countries.
In a press statement on Monday, November 21 COTU Deputy Secretary General Benson Okwaro said Atwoli was re-elected during the ongoing 5th Congress in Melbourne, Australia.

articles.title: This California farm offers turkey cuddling — no, really
articles.author: Cathy Free The Washington Post
articles.excerpt: Turkeys have sharp claws, pointy beaks and red saggy bits on their necks. Snuggle might not be the first word that comes to mind when seeing a feathered turkey waddling
articles.summary: BY CATHY FREE The Washington Post Turkeys have sharp claws, pointy beaks and red saggy bits on their necks. Snuggle might not be the first word that comes to mind when seeing a feathered turkey waddling across a farm.But Barbara Slaine was sitting on the ground at a California farm last year when a turkey named Sun shambled over and climbed into her lap.Slaine, 63, was visiting the Gentle Barn animal sanctuary from New York and had never had an encounter with a live turkey before."She nuzzled up into my chest and sort of bended into me, and I was struck by how soft she was, especially the top of her head," she said.
articles.authors: CATHY FREE The Washington Post,Cathy Free,Courtesy,Michelle Shiers,The Washington Post

articles.summary: Healthcare company Uniphar has today announced a deal to buy Dutch firm BModesto Group for a total consideration of €75m. articles.title: Apollo introduces national antimicrobial stewardship programme
articles.excerpt: To fight the rising incidence of antimicrobial (drug) resistance and improve patient outcomes
articles.summary: To fight the rising incidence of antimicrobial (drug) resistance and improve patient outcomes image credit- shutterstock Apollo, Asia's foremost integrated healthcare services provider, has announced the launch of an Antimicrobial Stewardship Programme (Apollo ASP) at a national level. The programme will sensitise care providers on antimicrobial resistance (AMR), an issue leading to a public health problem and is today one of humanity's top ten global public health threats. Dr Prathap C. Reddy, Chairman, Apollo said, 'Antimicrobial Stewardship Programme (Apollo ASP) will be the largest programme of its kind in the country to promote the rational use of antibiotics to combat the rising burden of antimicrobial resistance, also known as drug resistance in the community.

articles.title: Kendrapada: Olive Ridleys arrive for breeding off Gahirmatha
articles.author: Ashis Senati
articles.excerpt: A large number of Olive Ridley sea turtles have started arriving for the breeding season off the Gahirmatha marine sanctuary, considered the world's l
articles.summary: KENDRAPADA: A large number of Olive Ridley sea turtles have started arriving for the breeding season off the Gahirmatha marine sanctuary, considered the world's largest rookery, in Kendrapada ."Olive Ridley sea turtles usually start mating in the sea near their preferred nesting spot from November to December," said Manas Das , forest range officer of the sanctuary.The government has banned fishing in the marine sanctuary from November 1 to May 31 to protect the turtles. The ban applies to the stretch of sea up to a distance of 20 km from the coastline of Gahirmatha.

articles.title: How the cost-of-living crisis is impacting decisions made by car buyers
articles.excerpt: Advertisement feature from PIB Automotive Practice Group
articles.summary:
Simon Whicher, Sales Director, Cooper Solutions
The cost of living crisis is having a significant impact on 70% of new and used car buying decisions as a result of the rising costs facing UK households, with one in five buyers claiming they will delay their next purchase.
Research by eBay Motors Group* indicates that the rise in energy bills prompted nearly a quarter (23%) to say they will delay their next car purchase, while a further 29% will now buy a cheaper car and 20% will buy a smaller one.

articles.title: ABB raises $209 million from placing shares in its e-vehicle charging business
articles.author: ET EnergyWorld
articles.excerpt: The money was raised in a pre-IPO private placement, the company said, led by new minority investors. ABB had delayed its planned flotation of the business earlier this year, citing stock market…
articles.summary: ZURICH: ABB has raised roughly 200 million Swiss francs ($208.99 million) from issuing new shares in its electric vehicle charging business, the Swiss engineering and technology company said on Monday.The money was raised in a pre-IPO private placement, the company said, led by new minority investors. ABB had delayed its planned flotation of the business earlier this year, citing stock market turbulence.The placement of 8 per cent of the new company's stock would give E-mobility, which makes charging equipment for electric cars and buses, an equity value of 2.

articles.title: Patrons in gay club shooting hit gunman with his own weapon
articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.excerpt: COLORADO SPRINGS, Colo.
articles.summary: COLORADO SPRINGS, Colo. (AP) — As bullets tore through a gay nightclub in Colorado Springs, killing five people and wounding many more, one patron who'd been partying moments before rushed into action, grabbing a handgun from the suspect, hitting him with it and pinning him down until police arrived just minutes later. He was one of at least two customers who police and city officials credit with stopping the gunman and limiting the bloodshed in Saturday night's shooting at Club Q. The violence pierced the cozy confines of an entertainment venue that has long been a cherished safe spot for the LGBTQ community in the conservative-leaning city.

articles.title: Nespresso to launch paper-compostable coffee capsules
articles.author: Keystone-Sda Afp Reuters Sb
articles.excerpt: The Swiss coffee brand Nespresso plans to trial paper-based compostable capsules next year in Switzerland and France.
articles.summary:
Nespresso is one of Nestlé's biggest brands, with 2021 sales of CHF6.4 billion ($6.7 billion), and also one of its most profitable. Keystone / Laurent Gillieron
 

The Swiss coffee brand Nespresso plans to trial paper-based compostable capsules next year in Switzerland and France.
This content was published on November 21, 2022 - 09:39

November 21, 2022 - 09:39
 Nespresso, which makes home coffee machines, pods and accessories, will launch paper-based capsules that can be composted at home "in France and Switzerland in 2023" before spreading out to other markets in 2024, Nespresso chief executive Guillaume Le Cunff told AFP news agency on Monday.

articles.title: NYK signs MoU with JERA for cooperation in transporting fuel ammonia
articles.excerpt: The study will include examining the transport of fuel ammonia to the Hekinan Thermal Power Plant
articles.summary:
Home News NYK signs MoU with JERA for cooperation in transporting fuel ammonia 
 
 


 
The version for the print


 Since 2021, NYK has had a long-term GHG reduction target of net-zero emissions by 2050 for its oceangoing shipping business, and the company is working to establish a value chain for fuel ammonia, which does not emit carbon dioxide (CO2) when combusted. In establishing a new value chain ahead of the rest of the world, the standardization of carriers and the formation of rules such as laws and regulations are indispensable to realize large-scale transportation of fuel ammonia.

articles.title: MBB Story: Oregon Swings and Misses In Its Attempt to Upset No. 3 Houston
articles.excerpt: Written by: Jonah Bruneau Sure Sunday Night Football has been a staple for multiple decades now, but what about some Sunday night men's college hoops? That's what Eugene got on this Sunday night as…
articles.summary: Written by: Jonah Bruneau Sure Sunday Night Football has been a staple for multiple decades now, but what about some Sunday night men's college hoops? That's what Eugene got on this Sunday night as the Oregon Ducks played host to the No. 3 team in the nation and national championship favorites, the Houston Cougars. With the Ducks still trying to find their identity in this young season, they certainly had their work cut out for them against a team that is averaging just over 80 points per game. As it turns out, Oregon fought hard on defense all game long, keeping the Cougars to a modest 66 points.

articles.title: South Harz Potash granted three-year extension to Küllstedt exploration licence
articles.author: John Miller
articles.excerpt: The Küllstedt licence within the South Harz Project covers 242 square kilometres and contains an inferred resource of 1,538 million tonnes...
articles.summary: South Harz Potash Ltd (ASX:SHP), a potash exploration and development company focused on Germany, has been granted a three-year extension to the Küllstedt exploration licence within its flagship South Harz Project. This extension to January 2026 was granted by the Thuringian mining authority, Thüringer Landesamt für Umwelt, Bergbau und Naturschutz (TLUBN), within about one month of the application submission. The Küllstedt exploration licence covers 242 square kilometres and contains a JORC-compliant inferred mineral resource of 1.

articles.title: Animal Rights Challenge To Cartoon Poultry Product Labels Fails
articles.author: John M.
articles.excerpt: The labels in question — on chicken and turkey products produced by a vertically integrated poultry-production company — portrayed cartoon chickens and turkeys outside in fields.
articles.summary: A federal court in Washington, D.C. recently tossed a lawsuit brought by the animal rights group, Animal Legal Defense Fund (ALDF) challenging poultry products labels that had been approved by the Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS) of the U.S. Department of Agriculture. The court determined that ALDF had no standing to sue. ALDF v. Vilsack, No. 1-21-cv-01539 (CJN) (D.D.C. Nov. 14, 2022). The labels in question — on chicken and turkey products produced by a vertically integrated poultry-production company — portrayed cartoon chickens and turkeys outside in fields.

articles.title: Gotta patch these bugs! A review of ‘Pokémon Scarlet and Violet'
articles.author: Jackson Baldus
articles.excerpt: Read about the good, the bad, and the ugly in the latest entry to the series.
articles.summary:
Pokémon fans have waited three years since the release of 'Pokémon Sword and Shield' in 2019 for a new generation of monsters. The wait is finally over as Game Freak presents the ninth installment of the iconic series with 'Pokémon Scarlet and Violet.' 
This time, trainers were given the opportunity to explore the brand new Paldea region, which draws inspiration from Spain and Portugal. The game is presented as a never-ending road trip, where players are free to ride around on Koraidon and Miraidon to explore and battle at their own pace.

articles.author: DNA Web Team
articles.excerpt: Hengameh Ghaziani and Katayoun Riahi were arrested for
articles.summary: Photo: Instagram / hengamehghazianiIn an apparent act of defiance against their government, two well-known Iranian actresses have been jailed for showing support for the protest movement and removing their headscarves in public. Both actresses, in a show of support for their fans, made public appearances sans headscarves. In September, mass demonstrations erupted in Iran when it was claimed that 22-year-old Mahsa Amini had died while in the custody of Iran's Morality Police for allegedly violating hijab laws.

articles.summary: Subscribe to our Telegram channel for the latest stories and updates. Yang di-Pertuan Agong Al-Sultan Abdullah Ri'ayatuddin Al-Mustafa Billah Shah has exttended the deadline given to political parties until 2pm tomorrow. In a statement from Istana Negara, Comptroller of the Royal Household Datuk Seri Ahmad Fadil Shamsuddin said the extension was given after requests were made by the heads of political parties and political coalitions today. The King had previously given political parties until 2pm today to present the collaboration with the numbers to form the government and their prime ministerial candidate.

articles.title: EPA Takes Final Action To Protect Groundwater From Coal Ash Contamination At Ohio Facility
articles.excerpt: Today, the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) announced the latest action to protect communities and hold facilities accountable for controlling and cleaning up the contamination created by…
articles.summary: Today, the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) announced the latest action to protect communities and hold facilities accountable for controlling and cleaning up the contamination created by decades of coal ash disposal. The agency has issued the first final decision to deny a facility's request to continue disposing of coal combustion residuals (CCR or coal ash) into an unlined surface impoundment after the deadline to stop such disposal has passed. 'For too long, communities already disproportionately impacted by high levels of pollution have been burdened by improper coal ash disposal,' said EPA Administrator Michael S.

articles.title: South Africa pays tribute to DJ Sumbody
articles.author: Bronwyn Mckay
articles.excerpt: Oupa John Sefoka, better known as DJ Sumbody, died in the early hours of Sunday morning.
articles.summary: DJ Sumbody Photo: Gallo Images/Lefty Shivambu Oupa John Sefoka, better known as DJ Sumbody, died in the early hours of Sunday morning.The music producer was shot dead in a drive-by shooting; police are currently looking for the suspects involved.Following news of his death, South African fans and industry colleagues took to social media to pay tribute.Oupa John Sefoka, better known as DJ Sumbody, died in the early hours of Sunday morning.Sefoka's production company, Sumsounds Music, confirmed the music producer's death in a statement, announcing that he was involved in an "unfortunate incident".

articles.title: The Walking Dead Series Finale Reveals Why Daryl Dixon Goes To France
articles.author: The Walking Dead
articles.excerpt: The setting for Daryl Dixon's spinoff posed questions over the character's presence in France. The Walking Dead series finale explains the trip.
articles.summary:
Warning: spoilers ahead for The Walking Dead's series finale
Daryl Dixon's mysterious spinoff trip to France may be solved thanks to The Walking Dead's series finale. When AMC announced The Walking Dead would end with season 11, a spinoff series starring Norman Reedus' Daryl Dixon and Melissa McBride's Carol Peletier was revealed simultaneously. Peletier later dropped out as The Walking Dead's now-solo Daryl Dixon spinoff was confirmed as filming in Europe, with France as the focal point. Needless to say, this revelation raised questions over how and why Reedus' lone wolf character would sail across the Atlantic after The Walking Dead's ending.

articles.title: WeTrade Group Inc. Announces US$120 Million Agreement with Vmade Tech PTE. LTD for Launching Operation of WTPay Technology Tools in Singapore
articles.summary:

articles.title: Study suggests bats are an underrecognized arenavirus reservoir
articles.excerpt: Researchers reported the detection of arenavirus RNA from various species of bats sampled between 2007 and 2011 from Brazil.
articles.summary:
In a recent study published in the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention's (CDC) journal Emerging Infectious Diseases, a team of researchers reported the detection of arenavirus ribonucleic acid (RNA) from various species of bats sampled between 2007 and 2011 from Brazil.

Background

Of the four genera present in the virus family Arenaviridae, Mammarenavirus is the only genus that infects mammals. The genus is divided into the New World arenaviruses and the choriomeningitis–Lassa virus serocomplex, distributed worldwide.

articles.title: First Time to the Florida Keys? Here's What You Need to Know
articles.author: Lisa Beach

articles.summary:

articles.title: A £900,000 home near Southwold for sale has a slide to get downstairs
articles.author: Lizzie Thomson
articles.excerpt: Perfect if you're feeling a little lazy.
articles.summary:
Climbing up and down stairs on a regular basis can be a real effort – but a new property listing has a solution to this daily exertion. 
A modern home near Southwold has a slide in the hallway to help get downstairs faster.
The four-bed family home does have a conventional flight of stairs but, should residents wish, there's also a metal-covered slide connecting the floors.
The property – which is on the market for £900,000 – features a lounge, utility room and toilet and bedroom downstairs, as well as three more bedrooms upstairs and an en-suite – plus a main bathroom.

articles.summary: Those travelling on the M50 this morning are set to face major delays after the busy motorway floods. he hard shoulder and the first lane are flooded between J12 Firhouse and J11 Tallaght (North). This is due to heavy and thundery rain with fresh to strong and gusty southeasterly winds. The outbreaks of rain will continue into the afternoon with further flooding expected. While a gradual clearance will develop, heavy showers will follow the rain. Winds will slowly ease and veer westerly through the day.

articles.excerpt: PARIS — The AMF French markets regulator will take the time that is necessary to review the state's offer to fully nationalize nuclear power group EDF , the…
articles.summary:
Article content

PARIS — The AMF French markets regulator will take the time that is necessary to review the state's offer to fully nationalize nuclear power group EDF , the head of the regulator said on Monday.

France is buying out the 16% of EDF it does not already own to take the company private and have a free hand in running it as European governments seek to secure its energy supplies.

articles.summary:
(Nov 21): The Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) defended its stance on Binance.com and collapsed crypto exchange FTX, following criticisms about the differing treatment of the two firms since the regulator had previously alerted the public to Binance.com.
The 'clear difference' between the two was that Binance.com was 'actively soliciting' users in the city state, to the extent of offering listing in Singapore dollars among other incentives, while FTX was not, the MAS said in a statement on Monday (Nov 21).

articles.title: It's Scientists Against Techies in the Brain Implant World
articles.author: Thiago Arzua
articles.excerpt: A visit to the largest neuroscience conference in the world shows that not everyone has the same sci-fi expectations for brain-computer interface technologies.
articles.summary: During his military training in 1892, German psychiatrist Hans Berger was almost trampled to death by a horse-drawn cannon. At the exact same time, his sister had a sudden feeling he was in danger and decided to telegram her brother. Berger would later describe this as a 'case of spontaneous telepathy,' which made him dedicate a lifetime to understanding how brain activity can change someone's thoughts. That work would inspire him to create the electroencephalogram—a method for measuring brain activity that is now one of the most important technologies in all of neuroscience.

articles.title: ‘Extremists didn't make it': Why Republicans flopped in once-red Arizona
articles.author: Sammy Edwards
articles.excerpt: Arizonans rejected extremists. As the new governor, voters chose Katie Hobbs, the Democrat who oversaw the 2020 election, over Kari Lake, the extremist Trump-backed holdout who fought alongside white…
articles.summary:
Arizonans rejected extremists.
As the new governor, voters chose Katie Hobbs, the Democrat who oversaw the 2020 election, over Kari Lake, the extremist Trump-backed holdout who fought alongside white supremacists. They re-elected moderate Democrat Mark Kelly to the Senate against far-right Blake Masters, who equated abortion with 'genocide' and advocated the theory of the grand replacement. As Secretary of State, voters chose Adrian Fontes, the former election official who promised to protect the right to vote, over Mark Finchem, a self-proclaimed member of the Oath Keepers.

The Socceroo's kick off their Group D campaign tomorrow night against current holders France, going into the clash as serious underdogs. St Mirren midfielder Baccus grew up idolising the likes of former Aussie stars Harry Kewell, Mark Viduka and Tim Cahill, watching them as they represented their country at World Cups around the globe. Cahill scored one of Australia's most memorable ever goals at the tournament in 2014, lashing home a stupendous volley against Holland in Brazil which kissed the underside of the bar as it crashed into the net.

articles.title: Lidl Black Friday sale launches with TVs, laptops and tech for under £200
articles.author: ter
articles.excerpt: The budget supermarket is cashing in on the worldwide event, offering huge discounts on a number of highly-sought after items.
articles.summary: As Black Friday rapidly approaches, punters are eagerly awaiting to see what special offers high street retailers will be boasting ahead of Christmas. And while the event doesn't take place until November 25 this year, this Friday coming, a number of UK shops have already started slashing prices to get ahead of the curve in terms of competition. Argos, for example, has just announced its lowest ever prices on a litany of products, while Curry's is set to give away free televisions in its early sale.

articles.title: NHS 'might make the wealthy PAY for care' in Scotland
articles.author: John Ely Senior
articles.excerpt: The prospect of charging wealthier Britons for care has been touted by NHS bosses in Scotland tasked with coming up with ways to improve the sustainability of the health service.
articles.summary: Published: 04:28 EST, 21 November 2022 | Updated: 04:28 EST, 21 November 2022 NHS bosses in Scotland have touted the highly controversial idea of making wealthier Britons pay for care.The prospect of a 'two-tier' health service was mentioned in the draft minutes of a meeting of NHS Scotland health board chief executives in September.Such a move would be highly controversial as it is against the founding principle of the NHS that care should be free for all.  They also raise the idea of stopping free prescriptions for some medications.

articles.title: Morbi bridge collapse an ‘enormous tragedy': Supreme Court
articles.author: Krishnadas Rajagopal
articles.excerpt: NEW DELHI:
articles.summary:
November 21, 2022 02:58 pm | Updated 02:58 pm IST - NEW DELHI: 
A tribute banner near the bridge collapse site in Morbi, Gujarat, on November 10, 2022.
| Photo Credit: VIJAY SONEJI
The Supreme Court on Monday described the Morbi bridge collapse which killed 141 people, including 47 children, as an 'enormous tragedy'.A Bench led by Chief Justice of India D.Y. Chandrachud asked the Gujarat High Court, which has taken suo motu cognisance of the incident, to 'bear its time and attention' on ensuring an independent investigation into the role and responsibilities of Nagar Palika (municipality) officials and the agency which was in charge of maintenance and management of the 143-year-old hanging bridge.

articles.summary:
PARIS, Nov 21 (Reuters) - The AMF French markets
regulator will take the time that is necessary to review the
state's offer to fully nationalise nuclear power group EDF
, the head of the regulator said on Monday. France is buying out the 16% of EDF it does not already
own to take the company private and have a free hand in running
it as European governments seek to secure its energy supplies. When the state filed its offer with the AMF last month,
it expected to receive the go-ahead from the regulator around
Nov.

articles.summary: Soccer Football - FIFA World Cup Qatar 2022 - Spain Training - Qatar University Training Site 1, Doha, Qatar - November 21, 2022 General view during training REUTERS/Albert GeaDOHA, Nov 21 (Reuters) - The young Spain players at the heart of coach Luis Enrique's new-look side make their global debut on Wednesday when they face the experienced veterans of Costa Rica in their Qatar World Cup opening match.With captain Sergio Busquets the lone survivor of the Spain team that won the 2010 tournament in South Africa under then coach Vicente del Bosque, Luis Enrique has blooded a new generation of players in preparation for Qatar.

articles.summary: First Lady Jill Biden shared glimpses of US President Joe Biden's 80th birthday on Sunday as she penned down a heartwarming note for her husband. President Biden and Jill Biden have been married for almost 45 years.On her official Twitter handle, the First Lady marked her beloved's birthday by sharing images of them dancing together. The pictures feature Jill Biden in a sparkly sage green dress and the President in a classic black and white tuxedo. Sharing the images she wrote: 'There's no one else I'd rather dance with than you.

articles.title: Thanksgiving travel predicted to be brisk, near pre-pandemic levels
articles.author: Eric Schwartzberg
articles.excerpt: This holiday travel week is predicted to see the amount of travelers increase to near pre-pandemic levels and end up the third busiest for Thanksgiving travel since AAA started tracking in 2000.
articles.summary: In Ohio, 1.9 million will be traveling by car, the most popular mode but only a slight increase of .3%, according to AAA. Nationwide, Nearly 49 million people are expected to travel by car. While Thanksgiving road trips are up 0.4% from 2021, car travel remains 2.5% below 2019 levels.Air travel will see an increase in Ohio, with airports to be crowded with 215,873 people flying, according to AAA.Linda Hughes, spokeswoman for Dayton International Airport, said the airport, the airlines and TSA are prepared for the heavy holiday traffic and staffing is in place.

articles.title: Mobility scooter thieves target mum and daughter days apart
articles.author: Lauren Davidson
articles.excerpt: "It's not just our scooters that were taken."
articles.summary: A mother and daughter have shared their devstation after their mobility scooters were stolen just days apart amid a "spate" of scooter thefts in their local area. Both mother and daughter suffer from conditions affecting their ability to walk, and the thefts have left them 'deflated'.Sheryl Brown, 43, was returning home from a funeral on Friday, November 11, when she discovered her scooter had been stolen from her front garden, despite being locked up and secured.For three years, she has relied on a mobility scooter to get around after being diagnosed with fibromyalgia and a brain condition which impacts her nerves and spinal cord - and says she was left "deflated" to find that her only mode of transport was stolen.

articles.title: Remains of man found in smoldering rubble of downtown Los Angeles fire
articles.author: Associated Press
articles.excerpt: The remains were found as firefighters continued to cool down smoldering debris from a fire in a commercial building on the south side of downtown.
articles.summary:
The remains of a man were found in the rubble of one of two major fires in Los Angeles during the weekend, authorities said Sunday.

The remains were found shortly after noon as firefighters continued to cool down smoldering debris, Los Angeles Fire Department spokesman Brian Humphrey said in a statement. A canine team that can detect human remains was brought in but did not find any others.

The man's identity and cause of death will be determined by the coroner.

A firefighter who suffered burns in the blaze was hospitalized in fair condition early Sunday with an injury described as non-life-threatening, Humphrey said.

Cornwall's tourism boss has slammed "bloody tourists" who visited during the pandemic when the borders were closedCredit: Alamy
He slammed holidaymakers who visited Cornwall when the borders were closed, saying they "didn't want to be there".
He told Cornwall Live: "In the 1970s people were in Cornwall because they couldn't afford a proper holiday and there were a lot of chips on shoulders, and we felt that again in those two years.

articles.title: ‘You're going to run against him? Say his name'
articles.author: Tori Holland
articles.excerpt: Donald Trump and Chris Christie.Jim Watson/AFP via Getty ImagesTrump's would-be rival, Chris Christie, says GOP challengers are failing the "leadership
articles.summary:
Donald Trump and Chris Christie.Jim Watson/AFP via Getty Images



Trump's would-be rival, Chris Christie, says GOP challengers are failing the 'leadership test.'


This is because they treat Trump like 'Voldemort,' Christie said, and don't name him while calling him out.


The fictional villain is known as 'You-Know-Who' and 'He Who Must Not Be Named,' for fear of evoking his name.


Former New Jersey governor Chris Christie says Republicans who want to run against former President Donald Trump in 2024 need to start naming him while calling him out.

articles.title: Explainer-'Close Call' At Ukrainian Nuclear Plant
articles.author: Guy Faulconbridge
articles.excerpt: Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant, which is under Russian control, was rocked by shelling on Sunday, drawing condemnation from the U.N.
articles.summary:
A view shows the Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant in the course of Russia-Ukraine conflict outside Enerhodar in the Zaporizhzhia region, Russian-controlled Ukraine, October 14, 2022. 
Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant, which is under Russian control, was rocked by shelling on Sunday, drawing condemnation from the U.N. nuclear watchdog which said such attacks risked a major disaster.Repeated shelling of the plant in southern Ukraine has raised concern about the potential for a grave accident just 500 km (300 miles) from the site of the world's worst nuclear accident, the 1986 Chornobyl disaster.

articles.title: Armed men force delivery driver to take suspect device to police station
articles.excerpt: A major security operation is continuing in Londonderry.
articles.summary: Police StockA man has been forced at gunpoint to drive a car containing a suspect device to a police station in Londonderry.A major security operation is continuing in the city following a hijacking on Sunday night when the suspicious object was placed in a delivery driver's car in Curryneirin and he was forced to travel to the Waterside.The incident, which occurred at around 10.30pm, involved a number of men who forced the driver at gunpoint to abandon the vehicle – a grey Ford Mondeo – outside Waterside Police Station.

articles.title: 4 thói quen uống nước có thể khiến bạn mang bệnh
articles.author: MINH MINH
articles.excerpt: Uống nước đầy đủ là điều rất cần thiết với các bệnh nhân gút nhưng nếu uống sai cách có thể khiến bệnh trầm trọng, khó đi lại dẫn tới phải chống nạng.
articles.summary:
Uống nước đầy đủ là điều rất cần thiết với các bệnh nhân gút nhưng nếu uống sai cách có thể khiến bệnh trầm trọng, khó đi lại dẫn tới phải chống nạng.

Nhắc đến bệnh gút chắc hẳn ai cũng biết, căn bệnh này mang đến cho người bệnh vô vàn đau đớn. Khi lên cơn gút cấp, các khớp sẽ bị đau dữ dội, kèm theo sưng nóng đỏ khớp.

Hơn nữa, bệnh gút nếu không được điều trị kịp thời sẽ dễ tái phát, bệnh ngày càng trầm trọng, cơn đau mỗi lúc một dữ dội hơn, cuối cùng có thể xuất hiện biến dạng khớp, thậm chí ảnh hưởng đến việc đi lại hàng ngày, một số bệnh nhân có thể cuối cùng chỉ đi lại được bằng nạng ảnh hưởng nghiêm trọng đến sinh hoạt hàng ngày.

articles.title: Vietnam successfully grafts skin from brain-dead donor for the first time
articles.author: The Star Online
articles.excerpt: Ho Chi Minh City's Cho Ray Hospital becomes the first hospital in the country to successfully performed skin transplant from a brain-dead donor.
articles.summary: Doctors at Cho Ray Hospital in Ho Chi Minh City perform a skin graft from a brain-dead donor. - Vietnam News/ANN HO CHI MINH CITY, Nov 21 (Bernama) -- Ho Chi Minh City's Cho Ray Hospital becomes the first hospital in the country to successfully performed skin transplant from a brain-dead donor. According to Vietnam news agency (VNA), the recipient was a 27 years old male patient 'L.V.T' from southern province of Dong Thap, suffered a 50 percent of third-degree burns on the whole body. The hospital said last Thursday that after the transplant, the patient was discharged from the hospital in the second week.

articles.title: 'Close call' in shelling near nuclear reactor on Ukraine's frontline
articles.author: Pavel Polityuk
articles.excerpt: President Zelenskiy says eastern region hit by heavy artillery
articles.summary:
Ukraine narrowly escaped disaster during fighting at the weekend that rocked Europe's largest atomic power plant with a barrage of shells, some falling near reactors and damaging a radioactive waste storage building, the U.N. nuclear watchdog said.

It was not clear which side was responsible for the explosions at the Zaporizhzhia nuclear power station, which has been under Russian control since soon after it invaded Ukraine on Feb. 24.

Whoever fired on the plant was taking "huge risks and gambling with many people's live,", said Rafael Grossi, director general of the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA).

articles.title: Tokyo stocks edge up on firm exporters, insurance issues weigh
articles.excerpt: TOKYO (Kyodo) -- Tokyo stocks ended slightly higher Monday after the yen's fall against the U.S. dollar lifted some exporters, although disappointing
articles.summary:
This file photo shows the Tokyo Stock Exchange. (Mainichi) 
 TOKYO (Kyodo) -- Tokyo stocks ended slightly higher Monday after the yen's fall against the U.S. dollar lifted some exporters, although disappointing forecasts by major insurance firms late last week pressured the market. The 225-issue Nikkei Stock Average ended up 45.02 points, or 0.16 percent, from Friday at 27,944.79. The broader Topix index finished 5.54 points, or 0.28 percent, higher at 1,972.57. On the top-tier Prime Market, gainers were led by marine transportation, wholesale trade, and iron and steel issues.

articles.excerpt: After Kiara Advani and Vicky Kaushal's Govinda Naam Mera trailer dropped on Sunday, Vicky's wife Katrina Kaif, and Kiara's rumoured boyfriend Sidharth Malhotra reacted to it. Here's what the actors…
articles.summary: On Sunday, the cast and crew of Govinda Naam Mera unveiled the trailer of the film, which will premiere on Disney+ Hotstar next month. The comedy-thriller features Vicky Kaushal, Kiara Advani and Bhumi Pednekar in lead roles. Giving a shoutout the film's cast, Katrina Kaif and Sidharth Malhotra took to Instagram Stories to praise the trailer and upcoming film. Also read: Govinda Naam Mera trailerKatrina wrote along with the trailer on Instagram Stories, 'Looks too fun.' She added a star-eyed emoji.

articles.title: 14th Saeima's first decision may be creation of Ministry of Climate
articles.author: Please Enter Your Name Here
articles.excerpt: Saeima vice-speaker Zanda Kalniņa-Lukaševica said in an interview to LTV programme Rīta panorāma on Monday, 21 November, that the 14th Saeima may kick off its legislative work with the creation of the…
articles.summary:
Zanda Kalniņa-Lukaševica. Photo: Zane Bitere / LETA
Saeima vice-speaker Zanda Kalniņa-Lukaševica said in an interview to LTV programme Rīta panorāma on Monday, 21 November, that the 14th Saeima may kick off its legislative work with the creation of the Ministry of Climate and Energy.
Parliamentary committees will be composed this week. All factions presented their lists of candidates for each committee in the morning on Monday. The Saeima may approve the new committees and their members on Wednesday, 23 November.

articles.title: What Eurasia's Winter Will Be Like under a 'Third-year' La Niña?
articles.author: Mirage News
articles.excerpt: In the summer of 2022, scientists predicted that a 'third-year' La Niña is very likely to occur during the winter of 2022. Now, a team of researchers
articles.summary: Chinese Academy of SciencesIn the summer of 2022, scientists predicted that a 'third-year' La Niña is very likely to occur during the winter of 2022.Now, a team of researchers set out to study what the Eurasian climate will be like in the upcoming 2022 winter. Their findings were published in Advances in Atmospheric Sciences on Nov. 19.La Niña is a climate pattern in the Pacific Ocean that can impact weather worldwide. During La Niña winters, the northern hemisphere often experiences frequent cold air outbreaks and heavy snowfalls.

articles.title: Iran players at World Cup speak out in support of protests at home
articles.author: Phil Haigh
articles.excerpt: 'We are here but it does not mean we should not be their voice.'
articles.summary:
As protests against the ruling regime in Iran continue, some of the country's star footballers have spoken in support of their people while they prepare to play in the World Cup in Qatar.
The death of Mahsa Amini in custody of Iranian morality policy sparked weeks of protests, which have seen hundreds of deaths and thousands of imprisonments.
There were question marks over whether Iran would be able to compete in the World Cup as a result, but they get their campaign underway against England on Monday afternoon.

articles.title: World Cup Supercomputer rates England's chances in Qatar ahead of group opener
articles.author: Joshua Mbu
articles.excerpt: ENGLAND start off their World Cup Group B campaign against Iran but a supercomputer predicts it's NOT coming home. The Three Lions are heavy favourites to make the knockout stages in Qatar. B…
articles.summary:
ENGLAND start off their World Cup Group B campaign against Iran but a supercomputer predicts it's NOT coming home. 
The Three Lions are heavy favourites to make the knockout stages in Qatar.
Brazil are favourites to win the World Cup
England are predicted to lose to France in the quarter-finalCredit: Getty
Bettingexpert's supercomputer BETSiE ran 100,000 simulations and has rated England's chances of beating Iran at just above 70 per cent.
That would mean Gareth Southgate's bold 4-3-3 will have paid off.

articles.title: 45-year old woman creates record cycling solo from Gujarat to Arunachal Pradesh
articles.author: PTI
articles.excerpt: She faced many challenges along the way, particularly in Assam and Arunachal Pradesh with a total elevation gain of 15,679 m
articles.summary:
A 45-year-old mother of two has proved that age is just a number by cycling solo about 4000 km from Gujarat to Arunachal Pradesh in about 14 days.
Pune-based Preeti Maske began her ride from Koteshwar Temple on the western border with Pakistan on November 1 and cycled her way through Gujarat, Rajasthan, Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, West Bengal, Assam and Arunachal Pradesh, expedition's chief crew Ghanshyam Raghuwanshi told PTI on Monday.
Maske completed her 3995 km ride in 13 days, 19 hours and 12 minutes to reach Kibithu, near the border with China in Arunachal Pradesh at midnight of November 14, he said.

articles.title: Coinbase, MicroStrategy Bonds Tank as FTX Collapse Dents Institutional Confidence in Crypto
articles.author: Omkar Godbole
articles.excerpt: Bonds issued by cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase (COIN), and MicroStrategy (MSTR), a business-intelligence company and investor in bitcoin, have slumped as investor confidence in the industry slid in…
articles.summary:
Bonds issued by cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase (COIN), and MicroStrategy (MSTR), a business-intelligence company and investor in bitcoin, have slumped as investor confidence in the industry slid in the wake of FTX's collapse.
Coinbase's bond due 2031 has dropped 15% this month to 50 U.S. cents on the dollar, according to data source Finra-Morningstar, sending the yield – which moves in the opposite direction to price – to a record high 13.5%. The decline comes after nearly three months of consolidation and marks an extension of the bearish trend seen early this year.

articles.title: Van Gaal wanted to sign Mane at United
articles.author: The Peninsula Newsper
articles.excerpt: Netherlands coach Louis van Gaal has disclosed he wanted to sign the reigning African Footballer of the Year, Sadio Mane, while he was coach of Englis...
articles.summary:
Netherlands' coach Louis Van Gaal at a press conference at the Qatar National Convention Centre in Doha, yesterday. AFP
Netherlands coach Louis van Gaal has disclosed he wanted to sign the reigning African Footballer of the Year, Sadio Mane, while he was coach of English side Manchester United. 
The Dutch tactician was the second coach of the post-Alex Fergusson era, leading the former English champions from 2014 to 2016.
'I think that Mane is an extraordinary player,' van Gaal said yesterday while speaking to the media ahead of the Netherlands Group A opener against Senegal at the FIFA World Cup Qatar 2022.

articles.summary: SINGAPORE: Chicago soybean futures ticked down on Monday, giving up some of the last session's gains on uncertainty about demand from top buyer China amid rising COVID-19 infections. Wheat rose for the first time in four sessions, although gains were limited by an extension of a grain export corridor for Ukrainian shipments. "The increase is COVID-19 cases in China is seen as a bearish demand factor for food and energy consumption," Hightower said in a report. articles.title: Sooners pick up commitment from DT Ashton Sanders Sunday night
articles.author: Evan Lewis
articles.excerpt: It's not something that you can emphasize too much in game preparation, but everybody in the Oklahoma football program knew how massive Bedlam vs.
articles.summary:
It's not something that you can emphasize too much in game preparation, but everybody in the Oklahoma football program knew how massive Bedlam vs. Oklahoma State could be.
Not just for the product on the field, but in recruiting. The Sooners brought the house for the first time this season, and it paid off with the 28-13 victory.
Now it's paying off on the trail as Los Angeles Cathedral three-star defensive tackle Ashton Sanders announced his commitment to OU on Sunday night, following his official visit to Norman this weekend.

articles.summary: Liverpool has cut the price of the current season's kits to their cheapest price ever for one week only in the club's Black Friday sale. The sale, which could help parents and fans of the club get the kit at a lower price in time for Christmas, is offering 20% off everything in the store including official Nike kits, Christmas jumpers, retro shirts and souvenirs ranging from books and scarfs to statuettes and advent calendars. The home match shirt has been reduced from £100 to £80 in the sale, while the stadium shirt is down from £70 to £57 in the sale.

articles.summary: Cristiano Ronaldo had grabbed headlines last week, before the start of the 2022 FIFA World Cup, for his bombshell interview with Piers Morgan where he criticised Manchester United, its owners, talked about his relationship with incumbent coach Erik ten Hag and lashed out at former teammate Wayne Rooney for criticising him. On Monday, on the eve of Portugal's World Cup opener, Ronaldo made a shock appearance at the press conference and broke silence on the interview.Speaking to Morgan on TalkTV in an interview that was aired in two parts, Ronaldo admitted that he felt betrayed that some of the people at the club did not want him there and further added that he has no respect for Ten Hag.

articles.title: Polish refineries produce huge amounts of diesel, helping drive down fuel prices
articles.excerpt: Prices of diesel may be soaring, but Polish refineries are cashing in on the trend by producing the largest amount of diesel in years, according to the Polish Economic Institute (PIE). Experts at the…
articles.summary:
Poland did not record any deficits on the diesel market and its production in refineries is the largest in years, noted experts at the Polish Economic Institute (PIE)
editor: Grzegorz Adamczyk Naftoport Oil Terminal in the Port of Gdańsk. (Source: naftoport.pl) Prices of diesel may be soaring, but Polish refineries are cashing in on the trend by producing the largest amount of diesel in years, according to the Polish Economic Institute (PIE). Experts at the institute noted that diesel prices in European stations had increased by over 70 percent year-to-year, and insufficient diesel storage facilities and limited refinery outputs increased the prices of distillates.

articles.summary:

articles.summary: An ITV Coronation Street star reckons the soap could be axed in a decade thanks to the rise of streaming services. Charlie Lawson, who played Jim McDonald in the show, also claimed that viewing figures could have dropped as fans are getting "fed up" with the storylines on the soap. Charlie, 63, played the notorious criminal from 1989 until 2000 and has made brief cameos since he left the famous Manchester cobbles - but he believes time could be up. The Irish actor, who is no stranger when it comes to sharing his views, said: "I was there in the 90s for 11 years and we were getting between 16 and 20 million – and 5 million (viewers now) is not a lot.

articles.title: Pos Malaysia sees continued pressure amid macroeconomic headwinds
articles.author: The Star Online
articles.excerpt: KUALA LUMPUR: Pos Malaysia Bhd says its performance outlook remains challenging as macroeconomic headwinds are expected to further depress the already soft post-pandemic e-commerce market.
articles.summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Pos Malaysia Bhd says its performance outlook remains challenging as macroeconomic headwinds are expected to further depress the already soft post-pandemic e-commerce market. Announcing the 3Q results of the postal service operator, group CEO Charles Brewer added that accelerated in-sourcing by e-commerce marketplaces, aggressive pricing practices and "masking" continue to put pressure on parcel volumes for courier and logistics players in the country. "Pos Malaysia will continue to leverage our unparalleled reach to grow market share in the right segments, as well as take the appropriate actions to ensure that the current macroeconomic headwinds are best mitigated," he said in a statement.

articles.title: Russia questions Macron on his stand on FIFA World Cup: 'What about Russian athletes..?'
articles.author: Jigyanshushri Mahanta
articles.excerpt: Three days ahead of the kick-off for FIFA World Cup, French President Emmanuel Macron made headlines for his comments on the tournament being hosted by Qatar.
articles.summary: Three days ahead of the kick-off for the FIFA World Cup 2022, French President Emmanuel Macron made headlines for his comments on the tournament being hosted by Qatar. Speaking to reporters at a summit of the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation forum in Bangkok, the President avered that sports 'should not be politicized', as Qatar faces heavy criticism for hosting the World Cup despite the humanitarian issues in the country. Meanwhile, the Russian embassy in South Africa has now thrown shade at Macron's comments while referring to the ban on Russian athletes.

articles.title: The Samsung Galaxy S20 FE is getting Android 13 and One UI 5
articles.author: Manuel Vonau
articles.excerpt: Smash that update button on your Galaxy S22 FE
articles.summary: Over the past years, Samsung has become one of the best Android manufacturers when it comes to timely software updates. Only a few months after Android 13 launched in stable, the company's latest flagships already received One UI 5, Samsung's overarching software skin on top of the new Android version. And now, one of the most beloved Samsung phones of its time, the international Samsung Galaxy S20 FE, is in for the same treat. The Galaxy S20 FE follows right in the footsteps of the rest of the S20 lineup, which just started getting its Android 13 update a few weeks ago.

articles.summary:
Tottenham are reportedly monitoring Everton winger Anthony Gordon as they weigh up a potential transfer move for him in the future.
The highly-rated England Under-21 international continues to impress with his individual performances for Everton, though Frank Lampard's side have struggled as a whole so far this season.
According to football.london, Spurs are keen to keep an eye on Gordon in case a transfer opportunity arises, and one imagines the 21-year-old could be lured away from Goodison Park amid the Toffees' recent struggles.

articles.title: Pune truck accident: Short-term measures in place, but long-term steps key to lasting solution
articles.author: Ajay Jadhav
articles.excerpt: Among the long-term measures suggested to remedy the issues in the Navale bridge area was the proposal to construct a new bridge connecting Navale bridge and Wadgaon bridge.
articles.summary:
The slow pace of long-term remedial measures at the accident spot near Pune's Navale bridge – where a truck rammed into several vehicles on Sunday – continues to put the life of citizens at risk. At least six people were injured and 24 vehicles damaged in the accident, once again bringing focus on the stretch which is part of the Bangalore-Mumbai bypass.
In the past, the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC), along with the state government and the National Highway Authority of India (NHAI), had studied the stretch and identified several short-term and long-term measures to curb accidents.

Alex Sullivan and a friend known as ‘John' made the best of a bad situation on Saturday night when two Qatari strangers invited them back for a ‘naughty one' at their house.
After bumping into the two men – who they said were called Nawaf and Abdul-Aziz – they were taken back to a Qatari mansion where they had a wild night.

Photo license  

A recent marking exercise of male coco de mer trees by the Seychelles Islands Foundation (SIF) at the Fond Ferdinand reserve on Praslin has shown that its population is stable.
The SIF, which manages the reserve, made the announcement recently following the completion of the exercise which began in October 2021 and ended in September this year. The exercise was a precursor to a census the Foundation plans to hold later this year.

articles.title: Woman lives off McVitie's Digestives due to rare condition
articles.author: Gemma JonesSEO Writer
articles.excerpt: Talia was so ill her weight plummeted to five stone
articles.summary: A woman lives off a diet of digestive biscuits due to a rare stomach condition. Talia Sinnott struggles to keep food down due to gastroparesis - a chronic illness which means her stomach struggles to process food. The 25-year-old eats up to 10 packets of plain biscuits and crackers a day to try and survive. She was diagnosed with the rare condition four years ago and Talia's illness was so bad she was sick up to 30 times a day. READ MORE: John Lewis worker injected with herpes after 'mystery cancer' spreads to brain At one point, Talia was so ill that her weight plummeted by three stone until she weighed just five stone.

 When South African President Cyril Ramaphosa meets newly appointed UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak this week, he will try to persuade him to have the sanctions imposed on Zimbabwe lifted.

articles.summary:
LONDON - European traders are rushing to fill tanks in the region with Russian diesel before an EU ban begins in February, as alternative sources remain limited.

The European Union will ban Russian oil product imports, on which it relies heavily for its diesel, by Feb. 5. That will follow a ban on Russian crude taking effect in December.

Russian diesel loadings destined for the Amsterdam-Rotterdam-Antwerp (ARA) storage region rose to 215,000 bpd from Nov. 1 to Nov. 12, up by 126% from October, Pamela Munger, senior market analyst at energy analytics firm Vortexa, said.

articles.title: Suspected Kurdish militants fire on Turkish border town
articles.author: WSAV-TV
articles.excerpt: ANKARA, Turkey (AP) — Suspected Kurdish militants in Syria fired four rockets into a border town in Turkey, causing a number of injuries, Turkey's state-run news agency reported Monday. The rockets…
articles.summary:
ANKARA, Turkey (AP) — Suspected Kurdish militants in Syria fired four rockets into a border town in Turkey, causing a number of injuries, Turkey's state-run news agency reported Monday.

The rockets struck a high school and two houses in the town of Karkamis as well as a truck near a Turkish-Syria border gate, Anadolu Agency reported.

The rocket attacks came days after Turkey launched deadly airstrikes over northern regions of Syria and Iraq, targeting Kurdish groups that Ankara holds responsible for a Nov.
